intro: Chrysanthemum pallasianum var. brevilobum, commonly known as the narrow-lobed chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn, producing a range of colors from white to yellow and orange. This variety is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its compact growth and vibrant floral display.
